          <div class="bi_search">
           &nbsp;
          </div>
          <h2>
           Search Google Scholar for Articles
          </h2>
         </div>
         <div class="roundbox innerbox innerbox_20" id="content10101170">
          <div id="boxatt10101170" class="boxatt">
           <label for="searchText10101170">
            <img alt="Google Scholar Logo" src="http://lgimages.s3.amazonaws.com/google_scholar.jpg" />
           </label>
           <br />
           <input type="text" value="" id="searchText10101170" class="google_search_box" title="Google scholar search" />
           <br />
           <input type="button" onclick="var queryString = document.getElementById('searchText10101170').value;queryString = queryString.replace(/\\+/g, '+');var url = 'http://scholar.google.com/scholar?q=' + queryString;window.open(url,'GScholar');" value="Search" />
          </div>
         </div>

     <div id="contentcenter" style="width:520px;padding-left:0px; margin-left:0px; margin-right:8px; float:left;">
      <div id="centerboxes">
       <div id="wrapbox18320807">
        <div class="roundbox outerbox" id="18320807">
         <div class="roundbox headerbox" id="title18320807">
          <div class="bi_text">
           &nbsp;
          </div>
          <h2>
           How Should We Talk About Sex at Muhlenberg? (10 September 2013)
          </h2>
         </div>
         <div class="roundbox innerbox innerbox_1" id="content18320807">
          <p>
           <strong>
            Works about campus discussions of sexuality
           </strong>
          </p>
          <blockquote>
           <p dir="ltr" style="line-height: 1.15; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;" id="docs-internal-guid-6a8074d7-1642-ad25-5983-11ee6e4fca02">
           </p>
           <p>
            Askew, Julie. "Breaking The Taboo: An Exploration Of Female University Students' Experiences Of Attending A Feminist-Informed Sex Education Course."
            <em>
             Sex Education
            </em>
            7.3 (2007): 251-264. Available
            <a href="http://muhlenberg.idm.oclc.org/login?url=http://search.ebscohost.com/login.aspx?direct=true&amp;db=aph&amp;AN=25915555&amp;site=ehost-live&amp;scope=site">
             here
            </a>
            .
           </p>
           <p>
            Baber, Kristine M., and Colleen I. Murray. &ldquo;A Postmodern Feminist Approach to Teaching Human Sexuality.&rdquo;
            <em>
             Family Relations
            </em>
            50.1 (2001): 23&ndash;33. Available
            <a href="http://www.jstor.org.muhlenberg.idm.oclc.org/stable/585771">
             here
            </a>
            .
           </p>
           <p>
            Freitas, Donna.
            <em>
             Sex and the Soul: Juggling Sexuality, Spirituality, Romance, and Religion on America&rsquo;s College Campuses
            </em>
            . Oxford ; New York: Oxford University Press, 2008. Available in Trexler Library, call #205.66 F866s
           </p>
           <p>
            Killian, Michael, et al. "Information About Human Sexuality: Sources, Satisfaction, And Perceived Knowledge Among College Students."
            <em>
             Sex Education
            </em>
            11.4 (2011): 471-487. Available
            <a href="http://muhlenberg.idm.oclc.org/login?url=http://search.ebscohost.com/login.aspx?direct=true&amp;db=aph&amp;AN=66696589&amp;site=ehost-live&amp;scope=site">
             here
            </a>
            .
           </p>
           <p>
            Lambevski, Sasho Alexander. &ldquo;Movement and Desire: On the Need to Fluidify Academic Discourse on Sexuality.&rdquo;
            <em>
             GLQ: A Journal of Lesbian and Gay Studies
            </em>
            10.2 (2004): 304&ndash;308. Available
            <a href="https://muse.jhu.edu.muhlenberg.idm.oclc.org/journals/journal_of_lesbian_and_gay_studies/v010/10.2lambevski.html">
             here
            </a>
            .
           </p>
           <p>
            <span style="line-height: 1.15; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;">
             Quenqua, Douglas. "On Campus, Opening Up Conversations About Sex."
             <em>
              New York Times
             </em>
             17 Apr. 2012: 2. Available
             <a href="http://www.lexisnexis.com.muhlenberg.idm.oclc.org/lnacui2api/api/version1/getDocCui?lni=55F0-DNJ1-DXY4-X481&amp;csi=6742&amp;hl=t&amp;hv=t&amp;hnsd=f&amp;hns=t&amp;hgn=t&amp;oc=00240&amp;perma=true">
              here
             </a>
             .
            </span>
           </p>
           <p>
            Rogers, Anissa, Nick McRee, and Diana L. Arntz. "Using A College Human Sexuality Course To Combat Homophobia."
            <em>
             Sex Education
            </em>
            9.3 (2009): 211-225. Available
            <a href="http://muhlenberg.idm.oclc.org/login?url=http://search.ebscohost.com/login.aspx?direct=true&amp;db=aph&amp;AN=43641159&amp;site=ehost-live&amp;scope=site">
             here
            </a>
            .
           </p>
           <p>
            Scholer, Anne-Marie. "Sexuality In The Science Classroom: One Teacher's Methods In A College Biology Course."
            <em>
             Sex Education
            </em>
            2.1 (2002): 75. Available
            <a href="http://muhlenberg.idm.oclc.org/login?url=http://search.ebscohost.com/login.aspx?direct=true&amp;db=aph&amp;AN=6446322&amp;site=ehost-live&amp;scope=site">
             here
            </a>
            .
           </p>
          </blockquote>
          <div id="boxatt18320807" class="boxatt">
          </div>
         </div>
        </div>
       </div>
       <div id="wrapbox18320821">
        <div class="roundbox outerbox" id="18320821">
         <div class="roundbox headerbox" id="title18320821">
          <div class="bi_text">
           &nbsp;
          </div>
          <h2>
           Joan E. Bertin (21-24 October 2013)
          </h2>
         </div>
         <div class="roundbox innerbox innerbox_1" id="content18320821">
          <p>
           <strong>
            Works by Joan E. Bertin
           </strong>
          </p>
          <blockquote>
           <div style="line-height: 2; padding-left: 2em; text-indent: -2em;" class="csl-bib-body">
           </div>
           <div style="line-height: 2; padding-left: 2em; text-indent: -2em;" class="csl-bib-body">
           </div>
           <p>
            "Don't Cave In&nbsp;to the Book Banners."
            <em>
             National Coalition Against Censorship
            </em>
            . 13 June 1997. Web. 28 Aug. 2013. Available
            <a href="http://www.ncac.org/censorship_news/20030305%7Ecn067%7EDont_Cave_In_to_the_Book_Banners.cfm">
             here
            </a>
            .
           </p>
           <p>
            &ldquo;Don&rsquo;t Shake Down Kids Over the &lsquo;Harlem Shake&rsquo;.&rdquo;
            <em>
             Huffington Post
            </em>
            . 6 Mar. 2013. Web. 28 Aug. 2013. Available
            <a href="http://www.huffingtonpost.com/joan-bertin/dont-shake-down-kids-over_b_2822383.html">
             here
            </a>
            .
           </p>
           <p>
            "Letter from National Coalition Against Censorship regarding
            <em>
             Forever
            </em>
            ."
            <em>
             judyblume.com
            </em>
            . Web. 28 Aug. 2013. Available
            <a href="http://judyblume.com/blog_stuff/ncac_forever_letter.htm">
             here
            </a>
            .
           </p>
           <p>
            "Statement By The National Coalition Against Censorship In Support Of The FoodSpeak Coalition."
            <em>
             Center for Science in the Public Interest.
            </em>
            27 Apr. 1998. Web. 28 Aug. 2013. Available
            <a href="http://www.cspinet.org/foodspeak/press/ncac.htm">
             here
            </a>
            .
           </p>
           <p>
            "Views From The Executive Director: Video Games Back in the Crosshairs."
            <em>
             National Coalition Against Censorship
            </em>
            . 15 May 2013. Web. 28 Aug. 2013. Available
            <a href="http://www.ncac.org/censorship_news/118/Views-From-The-Executive-Director-Video-Games-Back-in-the-Crosshairs">
             here
            </a>
            .
           </p>
           <p>
            "Written Testimony of Joan E. Bertin, Executive Director, National Coalition Against Censorship on Regents Learning Standards and High School Graduation Requirements."
            <em>
             National Coalition Against Censorship
            </em>
            . 22 October 2003. Web. 28 Aug. 2013. Available
            <a href="http://www.ncac.org/education/related/20031022%7ENY-Albany%7EWritten_Testimony_Regents.cfm">
             here
            </a>
            .
           </p>
          </blockquote>
          <p>
           <strong>
            Works about Joan E. Bertin and the NCAC
           </strong>
          </p>
          <blockquote>
           <p>
            <em>
             National Coalition Against Censorship
            </em>
            . 2013. Web. 11 July 2013. Available
            <a href="http://www.ncac.org/who-we-are">
             here
            </a>
            .
           </p>
          </blockquote>
          <p>
           <strong>
            Works about censorship
           </strong>
          </p>
          <blockquote>
           <p>
            Adams, Ryan J. "An Objective Approach To Obscenity In The Digital Age."
            <i>
             St. John's Law Review
            </i>
            86.1 (2012): 211-247. Available
            <a href="http://muhlenberg.idm.oclc.org/login?url=http://search.ebscohost.com/login.aspx?direct=true&amp;db=aph&amp;AN=85427735&amp;login.asp&amp;site=ehost-live&amp;scope=site">
             here
            </a>
            .
           </p>
           <p>
            Burr, Vivien. "III. Sex And Censorship: The Case Of Buffy The Vampire Slayer."
            <i>
             Feminism &amp; Psychology
            </i>
            19.1 (2009): 123-127. Available
            <a href="http://muhlenberg.idm.oclc.org/login?url=http://search.ebscohost.com/login.aspx?direct=true&amp;db=aph&amp;AN=36313872&amp;login.asp&amp;site=ehost-live&amp;scope=site">
             here
            </a>
            .
           </p>
           <p>
            Clarkson, Jay, and Shana Kopaczewski. "Pornography Addiction And The Medicalization Of Free Speech."
            <i>
             Journal Of Communication Inquiry
            </i>
            37.2 (2013): 128-148. Available
            <a href="http://muhlenberg.idm.oclc.org/login?url=http://search.ebscohost.com/login.aspx?direct=true&amp;db=aph&amp;AN=87295168&amp;login.asp&amp;site=ehost-live&amp;scope=site">
             here
            </a>
            .
           </p>
           <p>
            Degenevieve, Barbara. "Censorship In The US Or Fear And Loathing Of The Arts."
            <i>
             Social Identities
            </i>
            13.2 (2007): 159-173. Available
            <a href="http://muhlenberg.idm.oclc.org/login?url=http://search.ebscohost.com/login.aspx?direct=true&amp;db=aph&amp;AN=24325571&amp;login.asp&amp;site=ehost-live&amp;scope=site">
             here
            </a>
            .
           </p>
           <p>
            Diamond, Milton. "Pornography, Public Acceptance And Sex Related Crime: A Review."
            <i>
             International Journal Of Law &amp; Psychiatry
            </i>
            32.5 (2009): 304-314.&nbsp;Available
            <a href="http://www.sciencedirect.com.muhlenberg.idm.oclc.org/science/article/pii/S0160252709000715">
             here
            </a>
            .
           </p>
           <p>
            Strub, Whitney. "The Clearly Obscene And The Queerly Obscene: Heteronormativity And Obscenity In Cold War Los Angeles."
            <i>
             American Quarterly
            </i>
            60.2 (2008): 373-398. Available
            <a href="https://muse.jhu.edu.muhlenberg.idm.oclc.org/journals/american_quarterly/v060/60.2.strub.html">
             here
            </a>
            .
           </p>
          </blockquote>
          <div id="boxatt18320821" class="boxatt">

          <h2>
           Dorothy Roberts (29 October 2013)
          </h2>
         </div>
         <div class="roundbox innerbox innerbox_1" id="content18320838">
          <p>
           <strong>
            Works by Dorothy Roberts
           </strong>
          </p>
          <blockquote>
           <p>

            <em>
             The University of Chicago Law Review
            </em>
            62.1 (1995): 209&ndash;273. Available
            <a href="http://www.lexisnexis.com.muhlenberg.idm.oclc.org/lnacui2api/api/version1/getDocCui?lni=3S3V-4DR0-00CV-K056&amp;csi=7358&amp;hl=t&amp;hv=t&amp;hnsd=f&amp;hns=t&amp;hgn=t&amp;oc=00240&amp;perma=true">

          <h2>
           Anne Fausto-Sterling (5 November 2013)

         </div>
         <div class="roundbox innerbox innerbox_1" id="content18320853">

           </strong>
          </p>
          <blockquote>
           <p>
            "The Bare Bones Of Sex: Part 1--Sex And Gender."
            <i>
             Signs: Journal Of Women In Culture &amp; Society
            </i>
            30.2 (2005): 1491-1527. Available
            <a href="http://muhlenberg.idm.oclc.org/login?url=http://search.ebscohost.com/login.aspx?direct=true&amp;db=aph&amp;AN=15825412&amp;login.asp&amp;site=ehost-live&amp;scope=site">

            </i>

          <h2>
           E. Patrick Johnson (12 November 2013)
          </h2>
         </div>
         <div class="roundbox innerbox innerbox_1" id="content18320875">
          <p>
           <strong>
            Works by E. Patrick Johnson
           </strong>
          </p>
          <blockquote>
           <p>
            <em>
             Appropriating Blackness: Performance and the Politics of Authenticity
            </em>
            . Durham: Duke University Press, 2003. Available in Trexler Library, call # 305.896073 J66a.
           </p>
           <p>
            <em>
             Cultural Struggles: Performance, Ethnography, Praxis
            </em>
            . Ann Arbor: U. of Michigan, 2013. Available in Trexler Library, call # 306.484 C753c.
           </p>

            "Feeling the Spirit in the Dark."
            <i>
             Callaloo
            </i>
            1998: 398.Available
            <a href="http://www.jstor.org.muhlenberg.idm.oclc.org/stable/pdfplus/3299441.pdf">

            </a>

            <i>
             Theatre History Studies
            </i>
            30.(2010): 1-13.&nbsp;Available
            <a href="http://muhlenberg.idm.oclc.org/login?url=http://search.ebscohost.com/login.aspx?direct=true&amp;db=aph&amp;AN=56567602&amp;login.asp&amp;site=ehost-live&amp;scope=site">

            </i>

         <div class="roundbox headerbox" id="title18320897">
          <div class="bi_text">
           &nbsp;
          </div>
          <h2>
           Linda Williams (27 January 2014)
          </h2>
         </div>
         <div class="roundbox innerbox innerbox_1" id="content18320897">
          <p>
           <strong>
            Works by Linda Williams
           </strong>
          </p>
          <blockquote>
           <div style="line-height: 2; padding-left: 2em; text-indent: -2em;" class="csl-bib-body">
           </div>
           <div style="line-height: 2; padding-left: 2em; text-indent: -2em;" class="csl-bib-body">
           </div>
           <p>
            "Cinema And The Sex Act."
            <i>
             Cineaste
            </i>
            27.1 (2001): 20. Available
            <a href="http://muhlenberg.idm.oclc.org/login?url=http://search.ebscohost.com/login.aspx?direct=true&amp;db=f3h&amp;AN=5886382&amp;login.asp&amp;site=ehost-live&amp;scope=site">
             here
            </a>
            .
           </p>
           <p>
            "Cluster Fuck: The Forcible Frame In Errol Morris's Standard Operating Procedure."
            <i>
             Camera Obscura
            </i>
            25.73 (2010): 29-67. Available
            <a href="http://muhlenberg.idm.oclc.org/login?url=http://search.ebscohost.com/login.aspx?direct=true&amp;db=f3h&amp;AN=51119025&amp;login.asp&amp;site=ehost-live&amp;scope=site">
             here
            </a>
            .
           </p>
           <p>
            "Film Bodies: Genre, And Excess."
            <i>
             Film Quarterly
            </i>
            44.4 (1991): 2-13.&nbsp;Available
            <a href="http://muhlenberg.idm.oclc.org/login?url=http://www.jstor.org/stable/1212758">
             here
            </a>
            .
           </p>
           <p>
            <em>
             Hard Core: Power, Pleasure, and the &ldquo;Frenzy of the Visible.&rdquo;
            </em>
            Berkeley: University of California Press, 1989. Available in Trexler Library, call # 791.436538 W724h.
           </p>
           <p>
            <em>
             Porn Studies
            </em>
            . Durham: Duke University Press, 2004. Available in Trexler Library, call # 363.47 P836s.
           </p>
           <p>
            "Power, Pleasure, And Perversion: Sadomasochistic Film Pornography."
            <i>
             Representations
            </i>
            (1989): 37-65. Available
            <a href="http://muhlenberg.idm.oclc.org/login?url=http://www.jstor.org/stable/2928483">
             here
            </a>
            .
           </p>
           <p>
            <em>
             Reinventing Film Studies
            </em>
            . London; New York: Arnold ; Co-published in the United States of America by Oxford University Press, 2000. Available in Trexler Library, call # 791.43015 R374f.
           </p>
           <p>
            <em>
             Screening Sex
            </em>
            . Durham: Duke University Press, 2008. Available in Trexler Library, call # 791.436538 W724s.
           </p>
           <p>
            <em>
             Viewing Positions: Ways of Seeing Film.
            </em>
            New Brunswick, N.J.: Rutgers University Press, 1995. Available in Trexler Library, call # 791.43 V699p.
           </p>
           <p>
            "Whitee Slavery" Versus The Ethnography Of "Sexworkers."
            <i>
             Moving Image (15323978)
            </i>
            5.2 (2005): 106-135. Available
            <a href="http://muhlenberg.idm.oclc.org/login?url=http://search.ebscohost.com/login.aspx?direct=true&amp;db=f3h&amp;AN=33339417&amp;login.asp&amp;site=ehost-live&amp;scope=site">
             here
            </a>
            .
           </p>
           <p>
            "Why I Did Not Want To Write This Essay."
            <i>
             Signs: Journal Of Women In Culture &amp; Society
            </i>
            30.1 (2004): 1264-1271.&nbsp; Available
            <a href="http://muhlenberg.idm.oclc.org/login?url=http://search.ebscohost.com/login.aspx?direct=true&amp;db=aph&amp;AN=14797381&amp;login.asp&amp;site=ehost-live&amp;scope=site">
             here
            </a>
            .
           </p>
          </blockquote>
          <p>
           <strong>
            Works about Linda Williams
           </strong>
          </p>
          <blockquote>
           <p>
            Williams, Linda. "Frenzy Of The Visible," Indeed!."
            <i>
             Cinema Journal
            </i>
            46.4 (2007): 106-108. Available
            <a href="http://muhlenberg.idm.oclc.org/login?url=http://search.ebscohost.com/login.aspx?direct=true&amp;db=f3h&amp;AN=26797898&amp;login.asp&amp;site=ehost-live&amp;scope=site">
             here
            </a>
            .
           </p>
          </blockquote>
          <blockquote>
           <p>
            <em>
             Linda Williams
            </em>
            . Available
            <a href="http://fm.berkeley.edu/people/faculty/linda-williams/">
             here
            </a>
            .
           </p>
          </blockquote>

          <div class="bi_text">
           &nbsp;
          </div>
          <h2>
           Film screening and panel discussion on abortion politics (11 February 2014)
          </h2>
         </div>
         <div class="roundbox innerbox innerbox_1" id="content18320905">
          <p>
           Bowman-Grieve, Lorraine. &ldquo;Anti-Abortion Extremism Online.&rdquo;
           <em>
            First Monday
           </em>
           14.11 (2009). Available
           <a href="http://firstmonday.org/ojs/index.php/fm/article/view/2679/2352">
            here
           </a>
           .
          </p>
          <p>
           Bryant, Amy G., and Erika E. Levi. &ldquo;Abortion Misinformation from Crisis Pregnancy Centers in North Carolina.&rdquo;
           <em>
            Contraception
           </em>
           86.6 (2012): 752&ndash;756. Available
           <a href="http://www.sciencedirect.com.muhlenberg.idm.oclc.org/science/article/pii/S0010782412004155">
            here
           </a>
           .
          </p>
          <p>
           Cave, Damien. &ldquo;Behind the Scenes: Picturing Fetal Remains.&rdquo;
           <em>
            New York Times Lens [Blog]
           </em>
           9 Oct. 2009. Available
           <a href="http://lens.blogs.nytimes.com/2009/10/09/behind-19/?_r=0">
            here
           </a>
           .
          </p>
          <p>
           Cozzarelli, Catherine, and Brenda Major. &ldquo;The Effects of Anti-Abortion Demonstrators and Pro-Choice Escorts on Women&rsquo;s Psychological Responses to Abortion.&rdquo;
           <em>
            Journal of Social and Clinical Psychology
           </em>
           13.4 (1994): 404&ndash;427. Available through
           <a href="https://library.muhlenberg.edu/illj%7ES0">
            interlibrary loan
           </a>
           .
          </p>
          <p>
           Feldt, Gloria. &ldquo;How Media Mistakes Fueled the High Court Abortion Ruling.&rdquo;
           <em>
            AlterNet
           </em>
           20 Apr. 2007. Available
           <a href="http://www.alternet.org/story/50788/how_media_mistakes_fueled_the_high_court_abortion_ruling">
            here
           </a>
           .
          </p>
          <p>
           Fitzpatrick, Kevin M., and Michele Wilson. "Exposure To Violence And Posttraumatic Stress Symptomatology Among Abortion Clinic Workers."
           <i>
            Journal Of Traumatic Stress
           </i>
           12.2 (1999): 227. Available
           <a href="http://muhlenberg.idm.oclc.org/login?url=http://search.ebscohost.com/login.aspx?direct=true&amp;db=aph&amp;AN=11308571&amp;site=ehost-live&amp;scope=site">
            here
           </a>
           .
          </p>
          <p>
           Halfmann, D. and Young, M. P. "War Pictures: The Grotesque as a Mobilizing Tactic."
           <em>
            Mobilization: An International Quarterly
           </em>
           , 15.1 (2010):1-24. Available through
           <a href="https://library.muhlenberg.edu/illj%7ES0">
            interlibrary loan
           </a>
           .
          </p>
          <p>
           Hern, Warren M. &ldquo;Proxemics: The Application of Theory to Conflict Arising from Antiabortion Demonstrations.&rdquo;
           <em>
            Population and Environment
           </em>
           12.4 (1991): 379&ndash;388. Available through
           <a href="https://library.muhlenberg.edu/illj%7ES0">
            interlibrary loan
           </a>
           .
          </p>
          <p>
           Ludlow, Jeannie. "Love And Goodness: Toward a New Abortion Politics."
           <i>
            Feminist Studies
           </i>
           38.2 (2012): 474-483.&nbsp;Available
           <a href="http://muhlenberg.idm.oclc.org/login?url=http://search.ebscohost.com/login.aspx?direct=true&amp;db=aph&amp;AN=82442622&amp;site=ehost-live&amp;scope=site">
            here
           </a>
           .
          </p>
          <p>
           Manninen, Bertha Alvarez. "Rethinking Roe v. Wade: Defending the Abortion Right in the Face of Contemporary Opposition."
           <i>
            American Journal Of Bioethics
           </i>
           10.12 (2010): 33-46. Available&nbsp;
           <a href="http://muhlenberg.idm.oclc.org/login?url=http://search.ebscohost.com/login.aspx?direct=true&amp;db=aph&amp;AN=56041709&amp;site=ehost-live&amp;scope=site">
            here
           </a>
           .
          </p>
          <p>
           Otterbein, Holly. &ldquo;Why Are Your Tax Dollars Feeding the Pro-Life Machine?&rdquo;
           <em>
            citypaper
           </em>
           5 Mar. 2012. Available
           <a href="http://www.citypaper.net/cover_story/2011-08-18-real-alternatives-pennsylvania-abortion-taxpayer-money.html?viewAll=y">
            here
           </a>
           .
          </p>
          <p>
           Rowlands, Sam. "Misinformation on Abortion."
           <i>
            European Journal Of Contraception &amp; Reproductive Health Care
           </i>
           16.4 (2011): 233-240. Available
           <a href="http://muhlenberg.idm.oclc.org/login?url=http://search.ebscohost.com/login.aspx?direct=true&amp;db=aph&amp;AN=62963512&amp;site=ehost-live&amp;scope=site">
            here
           </a>
           .
          </p>
          <p>
           "The War on Women."
           <em>
            New York Times
           </em>
           26 Feb. 2011. Available
           <a href="http://www.lexisnexis.com.muhlenberg.idm.oclc.org/lnacui2api/api/version1/getDocCui?lni=5288-PSD1-JBG3-64XF&amp;csi=6742&amp;hl=t&amp;hv=t&amp;hnsd=f&amp;hns=t&amp;hgn=t&amp;oc=00240&amp;perma=true">
            here
           </a>
           .
          </p>
          <div style="line-height: 2; padding-left: 2em; text-indent: -2em;" class="csl-bib-body">
          </div>
          <p>
           <span class="csl-entry">
            Williams, Jean Calterone. &ldquo;Battling a &lsquo;Sex-Saturated Society&rsquo;: The Abstinence Movement and the Politics of Sex Education.&rdquo;
            <em>
             Sexualities
            </em>
            14.4 (2011): 416&ndash;443.&nbsp; Available
            <a href="http://muhlenberg.idm.oclc.org/login?url=http://sex.sagepub.com/content/14/4/416.abstract">

            </a>

          </p>

          </div>
          <h2>
           Marlene Zuk (18 March 2014)
          </h2>
         </div>
         <div class="roundbox innerbox innerbox_1" id="content18320931">
          <p>
           <strong>
            Works by Marlene Zuk
           </strong>
          </p>
          <p style="padding-left: 30px;">
           &ldquo;The Case of the Female Orgasm.&rdquo; Perspectives in Biology &amp; Medicine 49.2 (2006): 294. Available
           <a href="https://muse.jhu.edu.muhlenberg.idm.oclc.org/journals/perspectives_in_biology_and_medicine/v049/49.2zuk.pdf">
            here
           </a>
           .
          </p>
          <p style="padding-left: 30px;">
           &ldquo;Courtship Song Is More Variable than Calling Song in the Field Cricket Teleogryllus Oceanicus.&rdquo;
           <em>
            Animal Behaviour
           </em>
           76.3 (2008): 1065&ndash;1071. Available
           <a href="http://www.sciencedirect.com.muhlenberg.idm.oclc.org/science/article/pii/S0003347208002571">
            here
           </a>
           .
          </p>
          <p style="padding-left: 30px;">
           <em>
            Paleofantasy: What Evolution Really Tells Us about Sex, Diet, and How We Live
           </em>
           . New York: Norton, 2013. Available in Trexler Library, call # 599.938 Z94p.
          </p>
          <p style="padding-left: 30px;">
           <em>
            Sexual Selections: What We Can and Can&rsquo;t Learn about Sex from Animals
           </em>
           . Berkeley: University of California Press, 2002. Available
           <a href="http://site.ebrary.com/lib/muhlenberg/docDetail.action?docID=10048946">
            here
           </a>
           .
          </p>
          <p style="padding-left: 30px;">
           "Same-Sex Insects."
           <i>
            Natural History
           </i>
           119.10 (2011): 22-29. Available
           <a href="http://muhlenberg.idm.oclc.org/login?url=http://search.ebscohost.com/login.aspx?direct=true&amp;db=aph&amp;AN=69835817&amp;site=ehost-live&amp;scope=site">
            here
           </a>
           .
          </p>
          <p style="padding-left: 30px;">
           &ldquo;Same-Sex Sexual Behavior and Evolution.&rdquo;
           <em>
            Trends in Ecology &amp; Evolution
           </em>
           24.8 (2009): 439&ndash;446. Available
           <a href="http://www.sciencedirect.com.muhlenberg.idm.oclc.org/science/article/pii/S0169534709001542">
            here
           </a>
           .
          </p>
          <p style="padding-left: 30px;">
           "Sperm And Eggs On Six Legs. (Cover Story)."
           <i>
            Natural History
           </i>
           119.6 (2011): 28-35. Available
           <a href="http://muhlenberg.idm.oclc.org/login?url=http://search.ebscohost.com/login.aspx?direct=true&amp;db=aph&amp;AN=61467545&amp;login.asp&amp;site=ehost-live&amp;scope=site">
            here
           </a>
           .
          </p>
          <p style="padding-left: 30px;">
           &ldquo;Survival, Reproduction, and Behavior.&rdquo;
           <em>
            Ecology
           </em>
           75.6 (1994): 1854&ndash;1855. Available
           <a href="http://muhlenberg.on.worldcat.org/discoveryoclc/4909691661">
            here
           </a>
           .
          </p>
          <p>
           <strong>
            Works about Marlene Zuk
           </strong>
          </p>
          <p style="padding-left: 30px;">
           <em>
            Professor Marlene Zuk
           </em>
           . 2014. Web. 20 Feburary 2014. Available
           <a href="http://www.cbs.umn.edu/explore/departments/eeb/faculty-research/directory/marlene-zuk">
            here
           </a>
           .
          </p>
          <p>
           <strong>
            Works about Sex from an Evolutionary Biology Perspective
           </strong>
          </p>
          <p style="padding-left: 30px;">
           Gray, Peter B. "Evolution And Human Sexuality."
           <i>
            American Journal Of Physical Anthropology
           </i>
           152.(2013): 94-118.&nbsp;Available
           <a href="http://muhlenberg.idm.oclc.org/login?url=http://search.ebscohost.com/login.aspx?direct=true&amp;db=aph&amp;AN=92016709&amp;login.asp&amp;site=ehost-live&amp;scope=site">
            here
           </a>
           .
          </p>
          <p style="padding-left: 30px;">
           Long, John A. "Dawn Of The Deed. (Cover Story)."
           <i>
            Scientific American
           </i>
           304.1 (2011): 34-39. Available
           <a href="http://muhlenberg.idm.oclc.org/login?url=http://search.ebscohost.com/login.aspx?direct=true&amp;db=aph&amp;AN=56515101&amp;login.asp&amp;site=ehost-live&amp;scope=site">
            here
           </a>
           .
          </p>
          <p style="padding-left: 30px;">
           Long, John A.
           <em>
            The Dawn of the Deed the Prehistoric Origins of Sex
           </em>
           . Chicago: University of Chicago Press, 2012. Available
           <a href="http://muhlenberg.idm.oclc.org/login?url=http://site.ebrary.com/lib/muhlenberg/Doc?id=10603477">
            here
           </a>
           .
          </p>
          <p style="padding-left: 30px;">
           Oikkonen, Venla.
           <em>
            Gender, Sexuality and Reproduction in Evolutionary Narratives
           </em>
           . Oxfordshire, England ; New York: Routledge, 2013. Available
           <a href="http://muhlenberg.idm.oclc.org/login?url=http://site.ebrary.com/lib/muhlenberg/Doc?id=10719754">
            here
           </a>
           .
          </p>
          <p style="padding-left: 30px;">
           South, Sandra H., G&ouml;ran Arnqvist, and Maria R. Servedio. "Female Preference For Male Courtship Effort Can Drive The Evolution Of Male Mate Choice."
           <i>
            Evolution
           </i>
           66.12 (2012): 3722-3735. Available
           <a href="http://muhlenberg.idm.oclc.org/login?url=http://search.ebscohost.com/login.aspx?direct=true&amp;db=aph&amp;AN=83835906&amp;login.asp&amp;site=ehost-live&amp;scope=site">
            here
           </a>
           .
          </p>

          </div>
          <h2>
           Denise Brennan (29 April 2014)
          </h2>
         </div>
         <div class="roundbox innerbox innerbox_1" id="content18320936">
          <p>
           <strong>
            Works by Denise Brennan
           </strong>
          </p>
          <p style="padding-left: 30px;">
           &ldquo;Competing Claims of Victimhood? Foreign and Domestic Victims of Trafficking in the United States.&rdquo; Sexuality Research &amp; Social Policy 5.4 (2008): 45&ndash;61. Available
           <a href="http://link.springer.com.muhlenberg.idm.oclc.org/article/10.1525/srsp.2008.5.4.45">
            here
           </a>
           .
          </p>
          <p style="padding-left: 30px;">
           "Key Issues In The Resetlement Of Formerly Trafficked Persons In The United States."
           <i>
            University Of Pennsylvania Law Review
           </i>
           158.6 (2010): 1581-1608. Available
           <a href="http://muhlenberg.idm.oclc.org/login?url=http://search.ebscohost.com/login.aspx?direct=true&amp;db=aph&amp;AN=52702855&amp;login.asp&amp;site=ehost-live&amp;scope=site">
            here
           </a>
           .
          </p>
          <p style="padding-left: 30px;">
           "Methodological Challenges In Research With Trafficked Persons: Tales From The Field."
           <i>
            International Migration
           </i>
           43.1/2 (2005): 35-54.&nbsp;Available
           <a href="http://muhlenberg.idm.oclc.org/login?url=http://search.ebscohost.com/login.aspx?direct=true&amp;db=aph&amp;AN=17204973&amp;site=ehost-live&amp;scope=site">
            here
           </a>
           .
          </p>
          <p style="padding-left: 30px;">
           &ldquo;Thoughts on Finding and Assisting Individuals in Forced Labor in the USA.&rdquo;
           <em>
            Sexualities
           </em>
           13.2 (2010): 139&ndash;152. Available
           <a href="http://muhlenberg.on.worldcat.org/discoveryoclc/4655432766">
            here
           </a>
           .
          </p>
          <p style="padding-left: 30px;">
           <em>
            What&rsquo;s Love Got to Do with It?: Transnational Desires and Sex Tourism in the Dominican Republic
           </em>
           . Durham: Duke University Press, 2004. Available in Trexler Library call # 306.74097 B838w.
          </p>
          <p style="padding-left: 30px;">
           "Women Work, Men Sponge, And Everyone Gossips: Macho Men And Stigmatized/Ing Women In A Sex Tourist Town."
           <i>
            Anthropological Quarterly
           </i>
           77.4 (2004): 705-733. Available
           <a href="http://muhlenberg.idm.oclc.org/login?url=http://search.ebscohost.com/login.aspx?direct=true&amp;db=aph&amp;AN=15918761&amp;login.asp&amp;site=ehost-live&amp;scope=site">
            here
           </a>
           .
          </p>
          <p>
           <strong>
            Works about Denise Brennan
           </strong>
          </p>
          <p style="padding-left: 30px;">
           <em>
            Denise Brennan
           </em>
           . 2014. Web. 20 Feburary 2014. Available&nbsp;
           <a href="http://explore.georgetown.edu/people/brennade/">
            here
           </a>
           .
          </p>
          <p>
           <strong>
            Works about Sex Tourism
           </strong>
          </p>
          <p style="padding-left: 30px;">
           Kara, Siddharth.
           <em>
            Sex Trafficking: Inside the Business of Modern Slavery
           </em>
           . New York: Columbia University Press, 2009. Available
           <a href="http://ciaonet.org/book/cup/0015649/f_0015649_13651.pdf">
            here
           </a>
           .
          </p>
          <p style="padding-left: 30px;">
           Keren-Paz, Tsachi.
           <em>
            Sex Trafficking a Private Law Response
           </em>
           . Oxfordshire, England ; New York: Routledge, 2013. Available
           <a href="http://muhlenberg.idm.oclc.org/login?url=http://site.ebrary.com/lib/muhlenberg/Doc?id=10719769">
            here
           </a>
           .
          </p>
          <p style="padding-left: 30px;">
           George, Shelly. "The Strong Arm Of The Law Is Weak: How The Trafficking Victims Protection Act Fails To Assist Effectively Victims Of The Sex Trade."
           <i>
            Creighton Law Review
           </i>
           45.3 (2012): 563-580. Available
           <a href="http://muhlenberg.idm.oclc.org/login?url=http://search.ebscohost.com/login.aspx?direct=true&amp;db=aph&amp;AN=77504605&amp;login.asp&amp;site=ehost-live&amp;scope=site">

           </a>

           <i>

           </i>

            here
           </a>
           .
          </p>
          <p style="padding-left: 30px;">
           United States.
           <em>
            Domestic Minor Sex Trafficking: Hearing before the Subcommittee on Crime, Terrorism, and Homeland Security of the Committee on the Judiciary, House of Representatives, One Hundred Eleventh Congress, Second Session, September 15, 2010
           </em>
           . Washington: U.S. G.P.O, 2011. Available
           <a href="http://purl.fdlp.gov/GPO/gpo4064">

           </a>

          </p>

           "Unpacking The Sex Trafficking Panic. (Cover Story)."
           <i>
            Contemporary Sexuality
           </i>
           47.2 (2013): 1-6. Available
           <a href="http://muhlenberg.idm.oclc.org/login?url=http://search.ebscohost.com/login.aspx?direct=true&amp;db=aph&amp;AN=86135392&amp;login.asp&amp;site=ehost-live&amp;scope=site">
            here
           </a>
           .
          </p>
          <p style="padding-left: 30px;">
           Weitzer, Ronald. "Sex Trafficking And The Sex Industry: The Need For Evidence-Based Theory And Legislation."
           <i>
            Journal Of Criminal Law &amp; Criminology
           </i>
           101.4 (2011): 1337-1369. Available
           <a href="http://muhlenberg.idm.oclc.org/login?url=http://search.ebscohost.com/login.aspx?direct=true&amp;db=aph&amp;AN=73365193&amp;login.asp&amp;site=ehost-live&amp;scope=site">
            here
           </a>
           .
          </p>

         <table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" width="100%">
          <tr>
           <td>
            <h2>
             Subject Guide
            </h2>
           </td>
          </tr>
         </table>
        </div>
        <div class="roundbox innerboxprofile" style="padding:5px;">
         <table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" width="100%">
          <tr>
           <td>
            <div class="profile_image_box" id="profile_image_box_63914">
             <a href="http://libraryguides.muhlenberg.edu/profile/cannon" title="View Profile">
              <img alt="Profile Image" border="0" src="//lgimages.s3.amazonaws.com/data/profiles/63914/kelly_2_feb_2013.jpg" class="profile_image_align profileimage" style="max-width:140px;" />
             </a>
             <div class="profile_display_name">
              Kelly Cannon
             </div>
            </div>
            <div class="profileh4">
             <div class="profilecontent">
              <b>
               Contact Info
              </b>
              <br />

              <b>
               Links:
              </b>
              <br />
              <a href="http://libraryguides.muhlenberg.edu/profile/cannon" id="profile_link">
               Profile &amp; Guides
              </a>
             </div>
             <div class="profilecontent">
              <b>
               Subjects:
              </b>
              <br />
              <a href="http://libraryguides.muhlenberg.edu/cat.php?search_cat=Humanities+and+Business&amp;mode=profile_search">
               Humanities and Business
              </a>
             </div>
            </div>
           </td>
          </tr>
         </table>
        </div>
       </div>
      </div>
      <div id="rightboxes">
       &nbsp;
      </div>
     </div>
    </div>
